item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: This week’s been long and hard, so we think we’re all deserving of something good and loving. Today’s amazing comic on After Care is by Ariel Vittori. I think we can all agree it’s just stunning bit of work. I hope you all send her some love. Something to also take note of is that […]
item.content:encoded:
Aftercare by Ariel Vittori

by Matthew Nolan on 04/11/2017 at 12:01 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Favorites »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Education »
  • Health »
  • Kinks »
  • Sex & Sexuality

This week’s been long and hard, so we think we’re all deserving of something good and loving. Today’s amazing comic on After Care is by Ariel Vittori. I think we can all agree it’s just stunning bit of work. I hope you all send her some love.

Something to also take note of is that Ariel is currently fundraising for her Erotic Comic Anthology – Melagrana (Pomegranate in Italian!). Which, judging by the thumbnails and pitch, will look STUNNING. There’s like 10 days left to back it!

  • Ariel Vittori
  • Ariel’s Twitter
  • Tumblr
  • Attaccapanni Press Twitter
  • Ariel on FilthyFigments

We’ll probably post another guest comic next week, as we slowly find our legs again. A little bit of recovery time is in order. I guess eventually we’ll talk about what’s happened this past week, once we’re fully able to digest and articulate it. In the mean time I hope you all stay good, happy and healthy! And please don’t fret or worry; as always our goal and purpose here is to stay and be as judgement-free, inclusive, and sex positive as possible. Thank you for all the support for what we try to do.

If you’re feeling especially supportive, consider dropping us a dollar or two on Patreon. It really does help us keep doing what we’re doing, and continue to pay amazing artists for sex education comics like this one.

└ Tags: after care, aftercare, ariel vittori, bdsm, communicate, communication, connection, emotions, follow up, love, mental health, mental state, play, reconnection, selfcare, sub space, subdrop, subspace, tlc

item.title: What the Fuck’s a Cuck?
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: This was a really fun and massive thing to deconstruct into a comic and, obviously, we were not able to show case EVERY kind of cuckolding scenario. There’s so many different facets and ways in which people try cuckolding, hotwifing/hothusbanding/hotspousing, BDSM, polyamory, and open marriages. This comic is all about this trio and how THEY […]
item.content:encoded:
What the Fuck’s a Cuck?

by Matthew Nolan on 04/04/2017 at 12:01 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Favorites »
  • Interviews »
  • Kinks »
  • Sex & Sexuality

This was a really fun and massive thing to deconstruct into a comic and, obviously, we were not able to show case EVERY kind of cuckolding scenario. There’s so many different facets and ways in which people try cuckolding, hotwifing/hothusbanding/hotspousing, BDSM, polyamory, and open marriages. This comic is all about this trio and how THEY live it, not a blueprint for every cuckolding relationship out there.

If you’re interested in this kink, it’s best to really spend a bunch of time looking at a bunch of different places, look at how others are practicing it and then come up with your own recipe, all the while communicating with each other thoroughly. There’s no CORRECT way to do this – find your own path!

To help you along the way: we’ve been recommended a fictional erotic book by Cara McKenna, called Crosstown Crush. We’ve been told it does an amazing job of showcasing a positive, healthy cuckolding relationship in a really hot way. We’ve been looking at some of Cara’s books with the intent to review them eventually, and what we’ve seen so far has been STELLAR – so knowing she’s got a good cuckolding one out, well, we fully recommend you picking it up if you want to learn or dive deeper into this kink.

  • Crosstown Crush

The comic was a beast and we’re both really proud of it! It came out good, I think! It’s a good bake, Mary.

EDIT 4/7/17
Apologies and Moving Forward
Matt and I dropped the ball and we so sincerely apologize for commenting on race-play in one of the blog post’s many edits (see bellow), obviously it is a subject we are extremely ignorant about. We are so sorry for our tone-deaf wording, we understand that we unintentionally conveyed hurtful messages that neither of us support.

We are going to take some time to reach out to colleagues who are better educated and try to come up with a productive way to move forward. We don’t know what that will look like yet, but we actively are trying to figure out how to do so.

Again, please accept our sincere apologies for fumbling this through our ignorance and inexperience. We hear you, we fucked up, we are listening and learning and genuinely trying to do better.
-Erika and Matt

EDIT 4/6/17
Removing and editing my other edit note! x2!
Sorry and my apologies for my previous edit notes. I didn’t mean to cause so much confusion and distress anyone, wasn’t my intent! All I had wanted to do was help reiterate the warning in the comic that if you research this kink, that there are really ugly, racist examples you might encounter, but it isn’t integral to the practice of cuckolding. So many sincere apologies that I upset anyone with my ignorant notes – learning as I go!
-Matt

EDIT 4/5/17
Quick Clarification! In the comic, I caution newbies about the prevalence of racist cuckold material to be found on the internet. I personally see a distinction between racism and consensual race-play. Racism is bad! Thoughtfully playing with loaded power dynamics for mutual, consensual erotic stimulation is fine! No kink-shaming here, just warning new-cuckold-interested-readers that there is legitimately shitty stuff out there that isn’t integral to cuckolding so it’s not a surprise when it pops up!


Help support what we do through patreon!

└ Tags: compersion, control, cuck, cuckold, cuckolding, fear, humiliation, showmanship, trust

item.title: Flip 0
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: Flippin’ Heck, my previous Flip Hole review is more than 3 years old! How time flies when your jerking for comics! Well I had some gripes about the Flip Hole back then. And while Tenga have seriously upped their game and made a really fantastic toy, some of those gripes are still lingering. I just […]
item.content:encoded:
Flip 0

by Matthew Nolan on 03/28/2017 at 12:01 am
  • Comic »
  • Penis Toys »
  • Review Comics

Flippin’ Heck, my previous Flip Hole review is more than 3 years old! How time flies when your jerking for comics!

Well I had some gripes about the Flip Hole back then. And while Tenga have seriously upped their game and made a really fantastic toy, some of those gripes are still lingering. I just can’t FEEL and separate out the sensations of each bump and lump well enough. It all feels same-y for me. But looking at other reviews – some people seem to REALLY dig just how soft it is. So maybe its just a dosn’t work for me-but-maybe-for-you sort of review.

Personally I’m not going to be reaching for this expensive toy often, and would encourage anyone shopping for a masturbation sleeve to see my other reviews first. There’s a lot of cheaper options that I think will treat your wang better. The Tenga Zero is like touching the future of sex toys, but I think, still isn’t worth that $100 entry fee. The zero might not be the willy hero you’re looking for.

Buy it from one of our Friends (With Benefits)

A few of you have asked us to cover some of these ribbed Fun Factory toys, like the Semilino and Stronic Drei. They sure are a visual delight – and heck Erika thinks they’re a good pick if you’re a person who NEEDS a lot of sensation on your dildo. But for her personally it just didn’t do the trick.

item.title: We-Vibe & App Privacy Issues
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: 4/8/16 EDIT – correcting some facts regarding the settlement! Hi everybody. It’s been in the news lately (3/14/17) that We-Vibe settled some litigation (without legal judgement) based on their tracking and using users’ sexual information through their more recently made app-enabled sex toys. While we haven’t had a chance to review one of the more […]
item.content:encoded:
We-Vibe & App Privacy Issues

by Matthew Nolan on 03/15/2017 at 11:30 am
Posted In: Blog

4/8/16 EDIT – correcting some facts regarding the settlement!

Hi everybody.

It’s been in the news lately (3/14/17) that We-Vibe settled some litigation (without legal judgement) based on their tracking and using users’ sexual information through their more recently made app-enabled sex toys.

While we haven’t had a chance to review one of the more recent We-Vibe 4 Plus models, we have reviewed a few app-enabled toys, so we felt it prudent to warn folks interested in picking up a more modern app-enabled toy that their sexy-info might not be AS secure as they might think!

We still love our old We-Vibe 2, the Tango, and more recently the Nova (which DOES have an app feature which we purposely didn’t use), and We-Vibe has also gone ahead and updated their software to be more secure with an app-patch in March. So we don’t think you should avoid We-vibe at all, they make some GOOD toys. Instead what we’re recommending is to just be aware that apps in general might not be as secure as you hope.

It’s probably a handy idea to treat ALL your sex toys this way for a while too. I’ve a sneaky feeling a lot of companies have been and are lax in sex toy privacy security issues, and that the industry as a whole is going to go through a bit of a wake up. Apps are a fun feature that have never felt core to our sex toy experiences – we’re more interested in the rumble it brings to our jungle, rather than the stats or wireless features which always felt gimmicky, and I guess that would be my recommended takeaway for you: If you’re interested in getting a sex toy, ignore the ‘App’ side of it and just consider the toy at face value. How’s it going to make my junk FEEL even if I don’t use the App?

Hope that helps! Stay safe everyone!

└ Tags: ap, app, news, privacy, security, we-vibe, wevibe

item.title: Puppy Play by Alex Reeder
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: And we’re back from ECCC! We had such a wonderful convention, thank you everybody for coming to visit and buying a book. It was such a wonderful and exhausting experience. Filling in for us as we recoup is the wonderful Alex Reeder and his comic on Puppy Play! We were so excited to get this […]
item.content:encoded:
Puppy Play by Alex Reeder

by Matthew Nolan on 03/14/2017 at 12:01 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Education »
  • Harnesses & Packing »
  • Kink & BDSM Toys »
  • Kinks »
  • Sex & Sexuality

And we’re back from ECCC! We had such a wonderful convention, thank you everybody for coming to visit and buying a book. It was such a wonderful and exhausting experience.

Filling in for us as we recoup is the wonderful Alex Reeder and his comic on Puppy Play! We were so excited to get this look at a kink the both of us know so little about! That whole bit on it being meditative and helpful for a busy anxious mind? Sounds pretty wonderful to me. Anyway, drop Alex a visit and send them some much deserved love.

  • SFW Tumblr
  • NSFW Tumblr
  • Twitter
  • Patreon

Also if YOU’RE interested in diving into the Puppy Play scene, and are looking for some neat gear, let me recommend Stockroom as a good go-to, they pretty much have the market on good BDSM starter gear:

  • Stockroom
Stockroom ALSO has a 15% discount for you, just add ‘OHJOY’ at checkout!

item.title: Kupala Night by PannaN
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: Im super excited to introduce you to PannaN and their comic on Kupala Night – a traditional mischievous night celebrated in Slavic Mythology and eastern Europe. I hadn’t heard anything about a sexy holiday night in the woods – so when PannanN came to us with this, I jumped at the chance – heck yeah […]
item.content:encoded:
Kupala Night by PannaN

by Matthew Nolan on 03/07/2017 at 12:01 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Education

Im super excited to introduce you to PannaN and their comic on Kupala Night – a traditional mischievous night celebrated in Slavic Mythology and eastern Europe.

I hadn’t heard anything about a sexy holiday night in the woods – so when PannanN came to us with this, I jumped at the chance – heck yeah I want to learn about a celebrated night of excuses-to-fornicate-in-the-woods! PannaN’s amazing art was just the cherry on top. I hope you all found it fun and informative – this is a REAL holiday and still some-what-differently is still celebrated every 6/7th of July!

  • Portfolio
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Tumblr
  • Slavonica Comic
└ Tags: celebration, education, festival, guest, guest comic, holiday, July, Kupala, Kupala night, PannaN

Thursday, March 2nd, 6:45-7:45 pm, room TCC 305: Sex Education, Erotica, and Comics: A Discussion […]
item.content:encoded:
Emerald City Comicon

by Erika Moen on 02/24/2017 at 2:35 pm
Posted In: Blog


My Dearest Perverts! Matt and I’re gunna be at the Emerald City Comicon in Seattle from March 2-5th!

We’ll be tabling with Topatoco on the sky bridge at booth 1102 aaaaaand I’m gunna be on some panels and stuff too!

Thursday, March 2nd, 6:45-7:45 pm, room TCC 305:
Sex Education, Erotica, and Comics: A Discussion with Limerence Press

Friday, March 3rd, 3:15-3:30 pm, booth 216:
Signing at Oni Press/Limerence’s table!

Saturday, March 4th, 2 – 2:30 pm, booth 216:
Signing at Oni Press/Limerence’s table!

Saturday, March 4th, 6:30-7:30 pm, room TCC 305:
The New XXX; The Smut Comics Underground

Sunday, March 5th, 11:45am-12:00pm, ECCC Live Stage, Level 4 Skybridge Lobby
Interview on Twitch TV
Live-stream interview talking about Limerence Press. You can watch from home, even!

We’ll be selling our books (including our BRAND NEW coloring book!), stickers, and maybe even some of my embroideries??? Haha, who knows!

Anyway, I hope we see you there!

└ Tags: Appearance, comic con, comiccon, comicon, eccc, emerald city, seattle, signing
